item.title: SAP fixes critical vulnerabilities in NetWeaver application servers
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: SAP has fixed two critical vulnerabilities affecting NetWeaver web application server that could be exploited to escalate privileges and access restricted information. [...]

item.title: CISA shares guidance for Microsoft expanded logging capabilities
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​CISA shared guidance for government agencies and enterprises on using expanded cloud logs in their Microsoft 365 tenants as part of their forensic and compliance investigations. [...]

item.title: MikroTik botnet uses misconfigured SPF DNS records to spread malware
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A newly discovered botnet of 13,000 MikroTik devices uses a misconfiguration in domain name server records to bypass email protections and deliver malware by spoofing roughly 20,000 web domains. [...]

item.title: Label giant Avery says website hacked to steal credit cards
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Avery Products Corporation is warning it suffered a data breach after its website was hacked to steal customers' credit cards and personal information. [...]

item.title: Hackers use Google Search ads to steal Google Ads accounts
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Ironically, cybercriminals now use Google search advertisements to promote phishing sites that steal advertisers' credentials for the Google Ads platform. [...]

item.title: Microsoft ends support for Office apps on Windows 10 in October
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft says it will drop support for Office apps in Windows 10 after the operating system reaches its end of support on October 14. [...]

item.title: Over 660,000 Rsync servers exposed to code execution attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Over 660,000 exposed Rsync servers are potentially vulnerable to six new vulnerabilities, including a critical-severity heap-buffer overflow flaw that allows remote code execution on servers. [...]

item.title: Windows BitLocker bug triggers warnings on devices with TPMs
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Microsoft is investigating a bug triggering security alerts on systems with a Trusted Platform Module (TPM) processor after enabling BitLocker. [...]

item.title: January Windows updates may fail if Citrix SRA is installed
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Microsoft is warning that the January 2025 Windows 11 and Windows 10 cumulative updates may fail if Citrix Session Recording Agent (SRA) version 2411 is installed on the device. [...]

item.title: Allstate car insurer sued for tracking drivers without permission
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton has filed a lawsuit against Allstate and its data subsidiary Arity for unlawfully collecting, using, and selling driving data from over 45 million Americans. [...]

item.title: WP3.XYZ malware attacks add rogue admins to 5,000+ WordPress sites
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new malware campaign has compromised more than 5,000 WordPress sites to create admin accounts, install a malicious plugin, and steal data. [...]

item.title: US govt says North Korea stole over $659 million in crypto last year
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​North Korean state-backed hacking groups have stolen over $659 million worth of cryptocurrency in multiple crypto-heists, according to a joint statement issued by the United States, South Korea, and Japan on Tuesday. [...]

item.title: Windows 10 KB5049981 update released with new BYOVD blocklist
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Microsoft has released the KB5049981 cumulative update for Windows 10 22H2 and Windows 10 21H2, which contains an updated Kernel driver blocklist to prevent Bring Your Own Vulnerable Driver (BYOVD) attacks. [...]
